---
title: "Diamond sizes"
date: 2022-09-12
format: 
  pdf:
    documentclass: article
editor_options: 
  chunk_output_type: console
execute: 
  cache: true
---



We have data about 53940 diamonds. Only
126 are larger than 2.5 carats. The
distribution of the remainder is shown below:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
smaller |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = carat)) + 
  geom_freqpoly(binwidth = 0.001)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Teachingcontent_files/figure-pdf/plot-smaller-diamonds-1.pdf){fig-pos='H'}
:::
:::
